I am a college student at the University of Texas in Austin and I am in the process of studying this for my test. I was reviewing your video and I found a mistake that can get all the people watching this video confused. The repressor doesnt no bind to the promoter. RNA polymerase only binds to the promoter. After the promoter in the sequence of DNA there is something called the operator, this is where the repressor and activator binds.

I think your model has a big problem , as i know the promoter is a certain sequence which promote binding of RNA polymearse - after promoter there is separate place called : operator , the repressor is actually bind to the operator not directly to promoter . maybe i'm wrong but please explain it if possible  thanks for your video ; )
actually, allolactose binds to the Lac repressor, not lactose.

LacO1 is located within the promoter. But the activator can be upstream to the promoter. So, the video isn't incorrect but it could have been more precise.
